instructions.title: How to use Color Format Converter

steps.title: Enter your color
steps.description: Type or paste any color value in HEX (#FF5733), RGB (rgb(255, 87, 51)), HSL (hsl(9, 100%, 60%)), HSV, CMYK format, or use a CSS color name like 'red' or 'skyblue'. You can also use the color picker button to select visually.

steps.title: View all formats
steps.description: Instantly see your color converted to all supported formats: HEX, RGB, RGBA, HSL, HSLA, HSV, CMYK, CSS variables, and SCSS variables. Each format has a copy button for quick clipboard access.

steps.title: Generate color palettes
steps.description: Click 'Generate' under Palette Generator to create harmonious color schemes. Choose from complementary, analogous, triadic, tetradic, or monochromatic palettes. Generate tints (lighter) or shades (darker) variations. Click any palette color to use it.

steps.title: Check accessibility
steps.description: Use the Contrast Checker to verify WCAG compliance. Test your color against white or black backgrounds. See if it passes AA and AAA standards for normal and large text to ensure your designs are accessible.

steps.title: Export and reuse
steps.description: Export your color data and palettes as JSON. Access your recent colors from the history panel. Copy any format with one click for use in your projects.
